name: Eye Lab VR
description:
A small experience we made at VR jam organized by Fabien Siouffi at Pamplona 89 in Barcelona in November 2017. 

The idea was to hack VR visionary system and experiment with alternative eyes like if you were an animal. What if people had different distance between the eyes or different field of view? Will we still recognize stereoscopy? What will happen if we can pull our eyes out of the head and turn them to look at ourselves?

Play this experience and you will figure it out, what is it like to have alternative eyes.

---------------

Controls:

Use VR controllers.

  • Slide with your thumb on the left touchpad to alternate eyes field of view. 
  • Slide with your thumb on the right touchpad to alternate distance between the eyes.
  • Grab your eyes with a hand by bringing your hand close to your head and pressing the trigger. Try to see yourself by turning your eyes towards your head. 

------------

P.S. 

It was tested with HTC Vive but probably also works with Oculus. It's just a 2 days jam and it's not super optimized but it's good enough for playing. Have fun!
